column4: i just installed nvidia drivers now my ubuntu will not boot up

kubuntu is like vista for linux
prefers kde, as he has a supercomputer

I'd be very verbose about it being your opinion and that it isn't necessarily the best for every user. ps, I don't think it matters much that you have a computer with lots of resources, at least not to me.
resources are very precious on a 486
so I'd be very careful about saying that kde is best. I'd present it and inform them about it's resource requirements as you see them.
